message.content:
cs.DB, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CR, cs.SE. 

The paper proposes a rule-based query answering method for relational data, which involves using additional knowledge represented as a set of rules. This approach is related to knowledge representation and reasoning, which falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The use of rules also suggests a connection to logic programming and deductive databases, which are subfields of databases (cs.DB). The paper also mentions the use of a prototypical implementation of the system coupled with the Jess engine, which is a rule engine commonly used in machine learning and data mining, indicating a possible connection to machine learning (cs.LG). The focus on economic crimes suggests a connection to computer security (cs.CR), and the use of a knowledge base and query answering method suggests a connection to software engineering (cs.SE).
